H0.text: The Sun is the source of the heat energy in the warm rock that a lizard sits on in a desert.

H1.text: The lizard's skin is the source of the heat energy in the warm rock that a lizard in a desert sits on.

H2.text: Deep within Earth is where the heat energy in the warm rock that a lizard in a desert sits on comes from.

H3.text: The decay of plant materials is the source of the heat energy in the warm rock on which a lizard in a desert sits.

A4.text: Historically they have been used in arid climates or warm temperate regions to keep buildings cool by absorbing solar energy during the day and radiating stored heat to the cooler atmosphere at night.
